glsa.title: BeanShell: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: BeanShell is vulnerable to the remote execution of arbitrary code via Java serialization or XStream from an untrusted source.

background.p: BeanShell is a small, free, embeddable Java source interpreter with object scripting language features, written in Java.

description.p: An application that includes BeanShell on the classpath may be vulnerable if another part of the application uses Java serialization or XStream to deserialize data from an untrusted source.

impact.p: Remote attackers could execute arbitrary code including shell commands.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All BeanShell users should upgrade to the latest version:
